alert.note: Alert for Coconino (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 30 at 12:04PM MST until July 30 at 3:15PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... The Pipeline Fire scar in... Coconino County in north central Arizona... * Until 315 PM MST. * At 1204 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain over the Pipeline Fire scar. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding in and around the Pipeline Fire scar. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of areas in and around the Pipeline Fire scar. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Flagstaff, Hutchison Acres, Doney Park and Little Elden Spring Horse Camp. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 89 between mile markers 423 and 424. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Schultz Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Immediately move out of and away from creeks and washes in the Pipeline Fire scar. Flash flooding is occurring or imminent. Turn Around, Don`t Drown if you encounter flood waters while driving. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
